title: Increase file upload limit to 20MB with size warning

requirements.summary: Increase maximum file upload size from 2MB to 20MB in frontend validation
acceptanceCriteria: Users can successfully upload files up to 20MB in size
The file size validation reflects the new 20MB limit
All file types are supported at the 20MB limit

file_operations.description: Update the MAX_FILE_SIZE constant from 2MB (2 * 1024 * 1024) to 20MB (20 * 1024 * 1024) in the file size validation logic within handleFileSelect and handleDrop functions

requirements.summary: Add warning message for files larger than 15MB to inform users about longer upload times
acceptanceCriteria: Warning message displays when a file larger than 15MB is selected
Warning message clearly communicates that larger files may take longer to upload
Warning does not prevent the upload, just informs the user
Warning appears before the upload starts

file_operations.description: Add a state variable to track when a file larger than 15MB is selected. In handleFileSelect and handleDrop functions, check if file size exceeds 15MB (15 * 1024 * 1024) and set the warning state. Display a warning message component (using existing toast system or inline alert) that shows 'Large file detected. Files over 15MB may take longer to upload.' before the upload begins

requirements.summary: Update UI text to display new 20MB file size limit
acceptanceCriteria: All UI text references to file size limits show '20MB' instead of '2MB'
Upload page displays the correct maximum file size

file_operations.description: Update all text content that displays the file size limit from '2MB' to '20MB'. This includes the helper text shown in the upload area and any error messages that reference the maximum file size
